decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing the combo potential of Underworld Breach to continuously recur cards from the graveyard, generating a powerful engine for card advantage and board control. The goal is to set up the combo pieces such as Vizier of Tumbling Sands and Lotus Field to generate mana to fuel the engine. Consign to Memory and Wish provide flexibility and extra options for the combo. The deck also includes various cantrips and card filtering tools to ensure consistency and smooth gameplay. Overall, the deck is designed to efficiently execute its combo strategy while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly cycle through your library using cards like Street Wraith and Curator of Mysteries to fill your graveyard with creatures. Then, use Living End to return all of your creatures from the graveyard to the battlefield, while your opponent loses their creatures. This combo strategy allows you to overwhelm your opponent with powerful creatures and disrupt their game plan. Additionally, you have access to Counterspells like Force of Negation to protect your combo and other disruptive cards to control the game.

The Boros Aggro deck focuses on maximizing damage output through a combination of efficient creatures, burn spells, and powerful enchantments. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Static Prison and Blood Moon. With support cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Elegant Parlor, the deck looks to close out games swiftly and decisively while maintaining a strong board presence.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly with cards like Pyretic Ritual and Ruby Medallion, allowing the player to cast spells like Glimpse the Impossible and Ral, Monsoon Mage multiple times in a single turn. The deck also includes ways to draw cards and find key pieces with cards like Wish and Valakut Awakening. By efficiently casting spells and generating mana, the deck aims to assemble a winning combination of cards to overwhelm the opponent in a single explosive turn.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Amped Raptor to quickly overwhelm opponents. With support from cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Goblin Bombardment, the deck aims to deal damage swiftly and efficiently. Additionally, the inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides a powerful late-game option. By combining creature aggression with strategic removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, this deck aims to outpace opponents and secure victory through relentless pressure.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quick, aggressive gameplay by utilizing creatures like Amped Raptor and Ocelot Pride to deal damage quickly. The deck also includes powerful cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to control the board and close out games. The inclusion of cards like Lightning Bolt and Static Prison help to control the opponent's creatures and disrupt their strategies. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggressive creatures and strong removal spells.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures using cards like Street Wraith and Generous Ent, and then cast Living End to bring all those creatures back onto the battlefield, potentially overwhelming the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Endurance and Force of Negation to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while Shardless Agent and Subtlety provide card advantage and flexibility. Overall, the deck aims to control the game early on and then execute its combo to finish off the opponent in a single turn.
